results.title: At the Super Bowl, Nostalgia’s the Only Game
results.abstract: When the present is divisive and the future is scary, pop culture’s biggest event plays “remember when.”

multimedia.caption: Jamie-Lynn Sigler appeared in a Super Bowl ad for Chevrolet that mimicked the opening credits of “The Sopranos.”
Jamie-Lynn Sigler appeared in a Super Bowl ad for Chevrolet that mimicked the opening credits of “The Sopranos.”
Jamie-Lynn Sigler appeared in a Super Bowl ad for Chevrolet that mimicked the opening credits of “The Sopranos.”

results.title: Wanda Sykes, Amy Schumer and Regina Hall to Host the Oscars
results.abstract: The comic actresses are in final talks for the job, which the producer Will Packer is adding back to the ceremony. The event had been hostless for the past three years.
results.byline: By Kyle Buchanan and Nicole Sperling

multimedia.copyright: Photographs by Rodin Eckenroth/Getty Images; Jamie Mccarthy/Getty Images; Jerod Harris/Getty Images

results.title: Ivan Reitman, Director of ‘Ghostbusters,’ Is Dead at 75
results.abstract: The filmmaker injected giant marshmallow boogeymen and toga parties into popular culture with movies that included “National Lampoon’s Animal House,” “Stripes” and “Kindergarten Cop.”

multimedia.caption: Ivan Reitman in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2011.
Ivan Reitman in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2011.
Ivan Reitman in Beverly Hills, Calif., in 2011.

results.title: Review: Beethoven Returns for the Age of Black Lives Matter
results.abstract: Heartbeat Opera’s powerful take on “Fidelio,” as an indictment of mass incarceration, has been revived and revised for a post-2020 world.

multimedia.caption: Bannister, left, as Stan, an imprisoned Black Lives Matter activist, and Griffin as Leah, his wife, who plots to free him.

results.title: Rap Takes Over Super Bowl Halftime, Balancing Celebration and Protest
results.abstract: Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and 50 Cent asserted the power of hip-hop’s oldies generation on pop music’s most-watched stage.

multimedia.caption: Eminem, Dr. Dre, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg took center stage at the Super Bowl halftime show on Sunday.
Eminem, Dr. Dre, Kendrick Lamar, Mary J. Blige and Snoop Dogg took center stage at the Super Bowl halftime show on Sunday.

results.title: ‘Somewhere With No Bridges’ Review: Of Men and Memories
results.abstract: Charles Frank’s documentary about a Martha’s Vineyard man tries to turn a shadow into a portrait.

multimedia.caption: Beauty shot: Ben Madeiras and Lucas Landers, in Charles Frank’s documentary “Somewhere With No Bridges.”
Beauty shot: Ben Madeiras and Lucas Landers, in Charles Frank’s documentary “Somewhere With No Bridges.”

results.title: An Exhilarating Set of Cecil Taylor’s Jazz Arrives, 49 Years Later
results.abstract: A performance recorded at Town Hall in 1973 went unreleased, partly because of its length. A digital-only release this week includes the 88-minute track “Autumn/Parade.”
des_facet: The Complete, Legendary, Live Return Concert (Album)

multimedia.caption: The pianist Cecil Taylor died in 2018. Much of a concert he recorded in 1973 at Town Hall in New York City went unreleased, until this week.
The pianist Cecil Taylor died in 2018. Much of a concert he recorded in 1973 at Town Hall in New York City went unreleased, until this week.

results.title: New York Artists in Need Can Apply for $1,000 a Month
results.abstract: A $125 million program offering guaranteed income to 2,400 artists across New York State who can demonstrate financial need is now accepting applications.

multimedia.caption: The pandemic highlighted some of the difficulties facing artists. When theaters were still closed last year, the musician Jon Batiste led a series of pop-up concerts.
multimedia.copyright: Nina Westervelt for The New York Times

results.title: ‘Encanto’ Soundtrack Tops Billboard Chart for Fifth Week
results.abstract: Propelled by streams of the hit “We Don’t Talk About Bruno,” the album notched the most weeks at No. 1 for a soundtrack since Disney’s “Frozen.”

multimedia.caption: The “Encanto” soundtrack, featuring songs by Lin-Manuel Miranda, continues to post strong streaming numbers.
The “Encanto” soundtrack, featuring songs by Lin-Manuel Miranda, continues to post strong streaming numbers.
The “Encanto” soundtrack, featuring songs by Lin-Manuel Miranda, continues to post strong streaming numbers.

results.title: ‘Space Dogs’ Review: To Boldly Go Where No Dog Has Gone Before
results.abstract: … Some never to return. This new Cold War musical about the Soviet-American space race pays tribute to the pups who preceded the cosmonauts.

multimedia.caption: From left, Van Hughes and Nick Blaemire, the stars and creators of the musical “Space Dogs,” with a lineup of hopefuls for a solo orbit in a Soviet spacecraft.
From left, Van Hughes and Nick Blaemire, the stars and creators of the musical “Space Dogs,” with a lineup of hopefuls for a solo orbit in a Soviet spacecraft.
From left, Van Hughes and Nick Blaemire, the stars and creators of the musical “Space Dogs,” with a lineup of hopefuls for a solo orbit in a Soviet spacecraft.

results.title: A Rousing Novel Follows a Brigade of Black Soldiers in the Civil War
results.abstract: In “Black Cloud Rising,” David Wright Faladé tells a classic war story based on a unit of soldiers, including many freed, recently enslaved people, that helped to hunt down rebel guerrillas in 1863.

results.title: Anna Sorokin on ‘Inventing Anna’ and Life After Rikers
results.abstract: In an interview ahead of the Netflix show’s release, Ms. Sorokin spoke about how her life has changed since the end of her Anna Delvey days.

multimedia.caption: Anna Sorokin in 2019, during her trial in Manhattan. She has spent the last year in ICE detention.
multimedia.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times

results.title: Glimpses of Northern India’s Vanishing Nomads
results.abstract: For centuries, Kharnak nomads have raised livestock in one of the most hauntingly beautiful — and inhospitable — places on earth. Can their traditions outlast a generational exodus?

multimedia.caption: A young Kharnak rider named Rinchen looks over his shoulder during a horse festival near the settlement of Yagang.
A young Kharnak rider named Rinchen looks over his shoulder during a horse festival near the settlement of Yagang.
A young Kharnak rider named Rinchen looks over his shoulder during a horse festival near the settlement of Yagang.

results.title: Marlon James’s Moon Witch Tells Her Side of a Haunting Story
results.abstract: The novel “Moon Witch, Spider King” traces the dark life of Sogolon, a ruthless avenger, complicated mother and captivating antihero.

results.title: Will We Ever Understand Addiction?
results.abstract: Carl Erik Fisher’s book, “The Urge,” partly a memoir of his own alcoholism, provides an overview of the many approaches that have been used to treat addictions.
des_facet: The Urge: Our History of Addiction (Book)

results.title: Sheila Heti Rewrites the Creation of the Universe
results.abstract: “Pure Colour” is a cosmological origin story, told through the eyes of a dissociative and grieving aesthete.

results.title: What’s on TV This Week: ‘The Eyes of Tammy Faye’ and ‘We Need to Talk About Cosby’
results.abstract: Jessica Chastain’s newly Oscar-nominated performance as Tammy Faye Bakker airs on HBO. And W. Kamau Bell’s docuseries about Bill Cosby wraps up on Showtime.

multimedia.caption: Jessica Chastain in “The Eyes of Tammy Faye.”
Jessica Chastain in “The Eyes of Tammy Faye.”
Jessica Chastain in “The Eyes of Tammy Faye.”

results.title: ‘Billions’ Season 6, Episode 4 Recap: Hungry Like the Wolf
results.abstract: Prince makes Kate an offer she can refuse. It’s just really hard to.

results.title: Kodak Black Is Shot in Los Angeles
results.abstract: The rapper, whose legal name is Bill Kapri, was shot in the leg while assisting another person after an “unprovoked attack,” his lawyer said.

multimedia.caption: Kodak Black performing in Miami Gardens, Fla., last year.
Kodak Black performing in Miami Gardens, Fla., last year.

results.title: Carmen Herrera, Cuban-Born Artist Who Won Fame at 89, Dies at 106
results.abstract: She painted in obscurity for decades, living on the earnings of her husband, an English teacher. Everything changed with a gallery show in 2004.

multimedia.caption: Carmen Herrera in 2016 in her Manhattan studio. She painted abstract geometric shapes for decades before winning widespread recognition.
Carmen Herrera in 2016 in her Manhattan studio. She painted abstract geometric shapes for decades before winning widespread recognition.
Carmen Herrera in 2016 in her Manhattan studio. She painted abstract geometric shapes for decades before winning widespread recognition.

results.title: Review: An Audition Season Begins at the Philharmonic
results.abstract: Jakub Hrusa is the first of several guest conductors appearing with the orchestra in the coming weeks as it searches for its next music director.

multimedia.caption: Jakub Hrusa leading the New York Philharmonic, which is searching for a music director to succeed Jaap van Zweden in 2024, at Alice Tully Hall.

results.title: Review: In Miami, a ‘Swan Lake’ That Blasts Off the Cobwebs
results.abstract: Miami City Ballet’s production of Alexei Ratmansky’s enthralling “Swan Lake” brings a beloved work into crisp, clean and musical focus.

multimedia.caption: Katia Carranza and Renan Cerdeiro in Alexei Ratmansky’s production of “Swan Lake” at Miami City Ballet.

results.title: An 8-Year-Old Street Child Is Killed, and a World Opens Up
results.abstract: In “Walking the Bowl,” Chris Lockhart and Daniel Mulilo Chama stumble upon a real-life murder mystery in a dump in Zambia.

results.abstract: Imogen Crimp’s debut novel, “A Very Nice Girl,” is a reminder of the dangers of caring too much about what other people think.

results.title: Stephanie Selby, 56, ‘A Very Young Dancer’ Who Inspired Many, Dies
results.abstract: A 1976 book of photographs and text traced her year at the School of American Ballet and made her famous. But a darker story lay underneath.

multimedia.caption: Stephanie Selby seemed to lead a charmed life as a ballerina appearing in George Balanchine’s “Nutracker.”  A book chronicling her dance life offered inspiration to many young girls.

results.title: Julie Saul, Effervescent Manhattan Gallerist, Is Dead at 67
results.abstract: She promoted photographers like Sally Gall and Arne Svenson, and she later broadened her gallery’s scope to include multimedia artists like Maira Kalman and Roz Chast.

multimedia.caption: Julie Saul in her West Village apartment with her dog Augie in an undated photo. Her career as a gallerist began when she and a friend sold photography out of an Upper West Side apartment in the early 1980s.

results.title: Radicals Used to Make Change. Then Social Media Happened.
results.abstract: Gal Beckerman’s “The Quiet Before” examines the births of social movements from the 17th century to the present day.

Gal Beckerman

results.title: ‘Improbable Journey’: How a Movie From Tiny Bhutan Got an Oscar Nod
results.abstract: “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom” was filmed on a shoestring budget in a remote Himalayan village. It’s now an Academy Award nominee, a first for Bhutan.
results.byline: By Chencho Dema and Mike Ives
des_facet: Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom (Movie)

multimedia.caption: The director Pawo Choyning Dorji, right, talked with Pem Zam, a young first-time actress from rural Bhutan, during the shooting of his film “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”
The director Pawo Choyning Dorji, right, talked with Pem Zam, a young first-time actress from rural Bhutan, during the shooting of his film “Lunana: A Yak in the Classroom.”

results.abstract: A reporter who has followed the scammer Anna Sorokin, a.k.a. Anna Delvey, for years watched the new Netflix series about the scandal. The reporter has thoughts.

multimedia.caption: Julia Garner plays the con artist Anna Sorokin, better known as Anna Delvey, in the Netflix series “Inventing Anna,” created by Shonda Rhimes.

results.title: After Pak and Beeple, What’s Next for NFT Collectors? Art Made With a Paintbrush
results.abstract: Now crypto collectors are investing in something more tangible, and traditional, like paintings and sculpture. And art dealers are rushing to woo them.

multimedia.caption: Felix Xu inspected an artwork by teamLab, “Impermanent Life,” at the Pace Gallery booth at Art Basel Miami Beach in December. Physical artworks pique his interest; after building a collection of 3,000 works in the metaverse, he bought a painting by Renqian Yang.

results.title: Reality Stars Are Just Like Us
results.abstract: In “True Story,” the sociologist Danielle J. Lindemann parses the enduring appeal and effect of the TV genre.
des_facet: True Story: What Reality TV Says About Us (Book)

multimedia.caption: With its rotating clusters of housewives, Kardashians, deck crews, dance moms, teen moms, top chefs, top models, 90-day fiancés, bachelors, bachelorettes, apprentices, house hunters and drag racers, reality TV Reality has mutated into a real-fake pro-am multiverse.

results.title: Lars Eighner, Who Wrote Eloquently of Being Homeless, Dies at 73
results.abstract: His 1993 memoir, “Travels With Lizbeth,” is considered a classic of the genre and brought him fame, but not fortune.
des_facet: Travels With Lizbeth: Three Years on the Road and on the Streets (Book)

multimedia.caption: Lars Eighner being interviewed shortly after his book “Travels With Lizbeth” was published in 1993. Lizbeth was the dog who shared his years without a home.
Lars Eighner being interviewed shortly after his book “Travels With Lizbeth” was published in 1993. Lizbeth was the dog who shared his years without a home.

results.title: Bob Saget’s Autopsy Report Describes Severe Skull Fractures
results.abstract: Such an extensive head injury would likely have left the actor confused, if not unconscious, experts said.

multimedia.caption: Experts said that Bob Saget’s head was so badly injured, it was unlikely that he would have intentionally ignored it.
Experts said that Bob Saget’s head was so badly injured, it was unlikely that he would have intentionally ignored it.
